header: I have been in Riga for the past 4 days already meeting lots of fellow Perl programmers. Both people I already know and new contacts. YAPC::EU officially starts today and I am looking forward to the talks and the further social interaction.
To those who could not attend, you can at least read some news from the past week...

entries.title: The future of Perl 5
entries.text: A very good summary of what's going on at the Perl 5 porters and what are the plans of Jesse Vincent for Perl 5. - I missed this one last week but it is important enought to include it now.

entries.title: And our theme for YAPC::NA 2012 is...
entries.text: After lots of really small posts about next years YAPC::NA finally one that has substantial content. If you wonder what is YAPC about (or what is the next YAPC::NA is going to be about) then this might give you some ideas.

entries.title: App::TimeTracker 2.008 released (finally!)
entries.text: A command line tool to track time spent on tasks.

entries.title: Compare deep data structures while doing correct comparisons for unordered sets
entries.text: Mark Gardner introduces his first module: Data::Compare::Plugins::Set::Object

entries.title: 2nd Mojocast: Placeholders, methods, formats
entries.text: This is the second episode of the terrific screencasts by Glen Hinkle showing features of the Mojolicious web framework.

entries.title: The Making of Mojocasts
entries.text: Explaining botht the technical background and the style needed to create the screencasts.

entries.title: Dan's updates regarding TPF and PPW for the week ending August 14th, 2011
entries.text: I am glad Dan provides some insight to the finances of TPF. This is light years better than what we had earlier but I am still at odds with the fact that this, the TPF part, does not appear on the official TPF website.

entries.title: So what is Dependency Injection again?
entries.text: Two explanations about dependency injection. When and why to use it. See this post and the following one by chromatic.

entries.title: @dotCloud loves Catalyst apps: Up-and-running in 10-minutes (#Perl in the cloud, Part III)
Binary search versus hash lookup - benchmarking
entries.text: As usual Ovid makes and excellent post with an excellent code example. He is comparing binary search of sorted data vs creating a lookup table and using it. The numbers speak for themself. Or do they?

entries.title: Hunting a Padre bug
entries.text: Sebastian Willing explains binary searching through SVN revisions in order to find a bug which is known as bisect in the git world.

entries.title: S26 in HTML
entries.text: Finally Synopsis 26 of the Perl 6 specification was also converted to HTML using the brand new Perl 6 pod parser.

entries.title: A compelling reason for Perl6
entries.text: Randal Schwartz wanted to discuss what 'killer application' could be built usign Perl 6 that would make it interesting for more people to learn Perl 6. Unfortunatelly the discussion drifted to the naming question again.

entries.title: Powerful benchmarking with Perl and ab
entries.text: A simple wrapper around 'ab' the command line tool to load test web sites.

entries.title: Params::Validate::Dependencies
entries.text: David Cantrel just announced the creation of an extension to Params::Validate. I have not looked at the features so I wonder if it wasn't a better idea to include this within Params::Validate itself?

entries.title: Five ways to install modules prereqs by hand
entries.text: David Golden shows us some examples to make it easy to install CPAN modules - almost - manually. Do you have other ways to improve or extend his suggestions?
